entry.title: [Fixit] Attempt to fix TabGridIncognitoReauthPromoTest
entry.content:
Speculative fix (will monitor test reviver). This does not repro on any

device I own nor on any emulators (including those on CI/CQ).



What appears to be happening is multiple copies of the Incognito card

are being displayed. One suspect for this is batching causing reset to

be delayed. Another is a lingering static variables for whether the

message card was shown. Fix this by both unbatching the test and

resetting the static value.



This same fix may apply to TabGridIphTest.



Also use onViewWaiting in the event the message cards are delayed.



This will likely pass CQ because we don't have any arm builders on

CQ that run chrome_public_test_apk only on CI :/



Bug: 1510419

entry.title: [exo] Take compositor lock on display scale change for maximized
entry.content:
When the display scale is changed, we need to resize the dp bounds for

maximized windows. For exo windows, this can cause graphical flashing

since the windows do not produce content with the updated size until

their configure completes. So, take the compositor lock.



This operation is heavy, so this CL introduces a slower timeout for the

compositor lock.



In a follow up CL, I will also fix redundant occlusion updates for

display scale change.



Bug: 1399478

Test: added unit test + local testing

entry.title: [App Management] Remove NOTREACHED()s from Mojo handlers
entry.content:
In most cases, we shouldn't crash if the App Management page handler is

called in an invalid way, and should instead just early exit. The mojo

interface can be accessed directly through Devtools, making it possible

for users to tickle these methods, and the WebUI renderer could also

(theoretically) be in a bad state.



I've changed NOTREACHED() to NOTIMPLEMENTED() where appropriate, which

more closely matches how we'd model this if we had inheritance instead

of ifdefs.



Bug: 1488244

Change-Id: I423850f3082f691620129815f440565c69c6757c

entry.title: Revert^2 "Lacros: Make InProcessBrowserTest wait for window creation"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8666014b805b7c0fa245f332ff05efabea4f7613.



Reason for revert: The problematic test had already been disabled.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Lacros: Make InProcessBrowserTest wait for window creation"

>

> This reverts commit 12a7ccdf6ca90e46de757c588745f9c441412ef1.

>

> Reason for revert: Suspected cause of failure of InputMethodLacrosBrowserTestAllParams/InputMethodLacrosBrowserTest.SetCompositionUpdatesSurroundingText/0 on linux-lacros-tester-rel: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-lacros-tester-rel/57746/test-results?sortby=&groupby=

>

> Original change's description:

> > Lacros: Make InProcessBrowserTest wait for window creation

> >

> > InProcessBrowserTest creates an initial browser. Tests should be able to

> > assume that this browser is visible. In Lacros tests that run

> > with Crosapi enabled, this requires extra work due to the concurrency of

> > Wayland and Crosapi.

> >

> > - Add an explicit wait operation after the initial window

> > creation to avoid race conditions in tests. It also adds the same wait

> > operation to various methods for browser creation such as

> > CreateIncognitoBrowser.

> > The wait operation is a noop on any platform but Lacros.

> >

> > - Simplify some existing tests that were manually doing wait operations

> > that are now redundant.

> >

> > - Work around a race condition in InputMethodLacrosBrowserTest uncovered

> > by the change: Once the initial browser window is fully created, the

> > omnibox has focus. Some tests relied on focus being elsewhere

> > at the beginning of the test body.

> >

> > Bug: 1235203, 1494785, b/315079554

> > Change-Id: I81cf3cbdcf2fe1eff2f4c0c70bb785d993543b9b

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5068434

entry.title: Add LacrosShelfItemTracker
entry.content:
This CL introduces a new crosapi interface LacrosShelfItemTracker.



LacrosShelfItemTracker allows Lacros to integrate windows with Ash

shelf.



Different windows with the same |item_id| will be grouped under a single

Shelf item.



|instance_type| denotes the client of the window (i.e. is it for an app

or dialog?) and allows the construction of a corresponding

ShelfItemDelegate.



|icon| is the optional Shelf item icon.



Change-Id: I84bdd51fd869b88f527090c48341aac86dc93a26

entry.title: WebNN: Fix DirectML binding table issue for reshaped constant tensor
entry.content:
The reshape operator of DirectML backend is implemented by creating a

new tensor description for its input node. However, the previous

implementation fails to set the `DML_TENSOR_FLAG_OWNED_BY_DML` flag if

its input node is a constant tensor. That caused the DirectML binding

table error during graph initialization.



This CL fixes this issue by setting the tensor flags of the reshape

operator's input tensor description to the output tensor description.

This ensures the output tensor description has

`DML_TENSOR_FLAG_OWNED_BY_DML` flag if the input node is a constant.



Because the previous implementation doesn't check DirectML binding table

error, that led the error to be reported when the graph was computed.

This CL also fixes that by calling

`IDMLDevice::GetDeviceRemovedReason()` after binding table invocations

that ensures the error being reported immediately.



This CL also adds two test cases for `gemm` and `add` operators that

take a reshaped constant operand as input.





Bug: 1509747,1273291

Change-Id: I7acd1a1087643077044bf3f13ffe04fc938b1147

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5109258

entry.title: [FilesTS] Ensure directory entry is native before getDirectorySize
entry.content:
When the function `setDirectorySize_` gets called in

metadata_box_controller it first verifies the entry is a directory then

unwraps the entry. However, for a subset of entry types there is no

underlying native type which is what the FMP getDirectorySize function

requires. To obviate this, bail out if the unwrapped entry is not a

native entry.

entry.title: [ios] Ensure Compacted SetUpList module is created
entry.content:
The compacted SetUpList can be created in -showSetUpListWithItems: in

two instances: from a direct call from the mediator or from

-viewDidLoad. Both instances can (and are often) called before

the Segmentation ranking has been received. Since

_setUpListCompactedModule needs to be instantiated by the time

-populateMagicStack: is called, allow for it to be instantiated

regardless of _magicStackRankReceived so that it is ready when

-populateMagicStack: is called from -setMagicStackOrder:.



Fixed: 1511059

Change-Id: If27b5db016bdafff3bb38ee36c9c97045149070a

entry.title: MediaApp/A11y: Switch to using RectF instead of Insets.
entry.content:

paddings or margins, so it's very unconventional to represent Box or

will do the conversion first before passing it over to the

entry.title: Use FormatUrlForSecurityDisplay to get status text of offline items
entry.content:
It is not recommended to convert URL to origin directly. We should use

FormatUrlForSecurityDisplay to display the origin of the download.

This is also consistent with the approach we used to display URL on

the downloads page[1].



The condition "available_pixel_width <= 0" is added because the first

call of GetStatusTextForLabel is before the view is inflated, so

available_pixel_width can be 0. This is consistent with the

implementation in url_formatter::ElideUrl[2] that we previously called.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/downloads/downloads_list_tracker.cc;l=135;drc=8e78783dc1f7007bad46d657c9f332614e240fd8

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/url_formatter/elide_url.cc;l=147;drc=a19e7b6a05969331ce18a2531201be5a201b6a88

entry.title: updater: Fix Meta-Installer duplicate args during elevation
entry.content:
This CL addresses two issues during the Windows Meta-Installer elevation.

1. When the installer is run as elevated, it attempts to build the

command line again. There is a bug where the tag is then appended

again on the second call to build the command line due to the tag

switch prefix check not accounting for the null terminator in the

call to memcmp.

2. When the installer command line is built, it always appends the

--enable-logging switch and the --vmodule switch to the command

line. This ends up duplicating both switches in the final elevated

process' command line.

To address both of these issues, we change to building the CommandString using base::CommandLine and checking if the command line has the aforementioned switches with the built-in HasSwitch function.



Fixed: 1504665

Change-Id: I6bf55469624e26e582bfb8f1d6c09bef8bcdc13e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5113853

entry.title: Default initialize all fields of PartialTranslateRequest
entry.content:
The unit tests create a PartialTranslateRequest without filling in all

the fields. This is fine for the string types, which are default,

initialized, but bool is not. Default-initialize everything, so we don't

need to risk problems with uninitialized fields.



This fixes the following UBSan error:

https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/build-8761892290068215089/test-results?q=PartialTranslateManagerTest.CreateResponse&sortby=&groupby=



While I'm here, I noticed an unnecessary copy of

PartialTranslateRequest. Fix that by using a const reference.



Bug: 1394755

entry.title: Revert "Clean up region search static page feature."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 51a178383fa36696a2a3de77a16b98c90b9a1d5d.



Reason for revert: This revert is only adding code back that used to already be in Chrome. We

are continuing development on a very similar feature, so this work is relevant again. We are

once again working on a feature that will take a screenshot of the users page, open it full

screen in a WebUI and allow the user to make text and visual search queries. Reverting this CL

forms the foundation of that work since this old feature already takes a screenshot and opens

it in a new tab. Since this prototype was already bare bones, almost all the code in this CL

is relevant, saving us several days of eng time.

entry.title: [Extensions] Clean up LazyContextId issues.
entry.content:
The CL cleans up issues within LazyContextId and how it's used.



1. LazyContextId currently stores the service worker scope for

instances created for a service worker-based extension. Since we

only ever register the extension's script at the root scope, there's

no need to store this, since it can be inferred from the extension's

ID.



2. ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::SequencedContextId is a std::pair

containing a LazyContextId and a base::UnguessableToken that's

generated when the queue tries to activate the service worker. This

CL changes this to a struct with named fields for clarity. It also

only stores the extension's ID and the BrowserContext from the

LazyContextId, since that's all that's needed.



3. There are places where LazyContextId instances are created and the

type of the instance (for and EventPage-based extension or a service

worker-based extension) is inferred from the constructor used. Since

the scope is no longer saved, there is no longer a need for unique

constructors and the type cannot be inferred. This CL adds static

member functions that are clearly named and create the expected

type of LazyContextId. There is also an option to create one for

an extension where the function determines the type of LazyContextId

based on the extension. This is the safest and clearest way, so many

call sites are migrated to use this static member function.



Bug: None

Change-Id: If40c9a7fa9fa0148bb2d1b0faa7f988a18dfe654

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5050418

Reviewed-by: Fabian Sommer

Reviewed-by: Ben Reich

Reviewed-by: Trent Apted

Auto-Submit: David Bertoni

Commit-Queue: David Bertoni

Reviewed-by: Devlin Cronin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1236662}

entry.title: Replace SetProminent() with SetStyle(ButtonStyle::kProminent)
entry.content:
Previously, MdTextButton only had 2 styles that could be set with

SetProminent(). With the addition of a new style, now button style is

set with SetStyle.



Therefore, this remove calls of IsProminent() in favor of SetStyle(ButtonStyle::kProminent) in BubbleSyncPromoSigninButtonView.

This requires callers passing button_style instead of a boolean.



No functionality changed.

entry.title: Prepare for federated flag
entry.content:
We want to enable federated features by default

(https://crrev.com/c/5075755), which listens to user login status

changes to bootstrap federated service via mojo call.

Because some unittests of ash_webui_unittests and

ash_components_unittests involve user login, and the unittest env

doesn't have mojo & dbus properly setup, these unittests crash.



See https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-chromeos-rel/1800546/overview



This CL resolves this issue by injecting a fake federated service

connection to ash_test_helper used by these tests that responds to

federated service calls with success.



Bug: b:315194729

Test: ash_webui_unittests & ash_components_unittests && chromeos_unittests

Change-Id: Ica78dfd481438032d0f7d09b2bef2f8018eb82b8

entry.title: Ensure SadTab is shown even when previously hidden due to speculative
entry.content:
frame swap



This change resets the sad tab in sad_tab_helper on RenderFrameCreated,

to better match the logic that hides it in WebView:

WebView::RenderFrameHostChanged ->

WebView::SetUpNewMainFrame ->

WebView::UpdateCrashedOverlayView // Before RenderFrameHostChanged,

web_contents()->IsCrashed() gets reset (to false), and this function

will mark it not-visible as a result.



In SadTabHelper, RenderViewReady may happen after

PrimaryMainFrameRenderProcessGone, so it isn't a suitable place to

clear sad_tab_. Subsequent PrimaryMainFrameRenderProcessGone are

ignored by SadTabHelper, so WebView doesn't get the signal to

show the crash overlay view again.



This change removes the sad_tab_ in RenderFrameCreated, ensuring we

show the sad tab if we swap render frames and that one also crashes.



Added a test that fails without the change



Bug: 1502678

Change-Id: Ice1232cd7f0b9c46d8b591c7126745a54c820f17

entry.title: Show more information in layout tree dumps
entry.content:
* Show the following information next to the LayoutObject class name as

well as "anonymous" and position type:

- "inline" for inline-block, inline-flex, inline-grid, and inline-table

- "block" for block-level replaced elements

- "children-inline" for IFCs



* Show them in a single pair of "(" and ")"

e.g. "(anonymous) (positioned)" -> "(anonymous, positioned)"



* Dump layout tree if a DCHECK in BlockNode::NextSibling() fails.



This CL has no production behavior changes.

entry.title: WebUI Mojo Bindings: use_typescript_sources-->generate_webui_js_bindings
entry.content:
The use_typescript_sources parameter was confusing to reviewers (not

clear what "sources" it refers to, or that it is WebUI-specific), and

is now default true/on which is the reverse of convention and confuses

developers about when the parameter needs to be specified.



Renaming it to generate_webui_js_bindings, changing to default "off",

and limiting the parameter to ChromeOS Ash since WebUI bindings always

use TypeScript on other platforms.



In this CL updating all uses in chrome/browser/ and chromeos/

entry.title: Revert "[ios] Revert workaround to avoid CHECK failure"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ded53ab64f91615494a3667b345e82e0e8d86676.



Reason for revert: Top crasher in M121 beta.



Fixed: 1509682



Original change's description:

> [ios] Revert workaround to avoid CHECK failure

>

> `CHECK(image.CGImage)` was removed by crrev.com/c/4918971 but this CL

> brings it back because the root cause was fixed by

> crrev.com/c/4974946.

>

> The root cause was introduced by crrev.com/c/4875382, which resized

> `baseView.frame` that should not be changed. It led that the visible

> part in a chrome:// page shrank every time a user reloaded a page.

> The height of `baseView` eventually became a negative value and

> `imageWithActions:` method in UIGraphicsImageRenderer didn't work well

> with a negative value. It created an image that doesn't have CGImage.

>

entry.content:
Rust handles bigger inputs than C++ and therefore the test takes longer.

This CL trims down the number of scenarios that the test covers. This

lowers the execution time of the test by a bit more than 50%.



Hopefully this CL is sufficient to avoid flaky timeouts of this test.

If not, then we can follow-up by breaking down the test into separate,

smaller, individual tests.

entry.title: [ios] Https Upgrades: Ignore POST navigations
entry.content:
HTTPS Upgrades automatically upgrades main frame navigations to HTTPS

with a fallback to HTTP. On non-iOS platforms, the feature ignores

POST navigations. This CL does the same on iOS.



The main upgrade/fallback logic is in the tab helper's

ShouldAllowResponse(), but this method doesn't have any information

about the request type. So we store the is-POST information when a new

navigation starts and reuse it in ShouldAllowResponse().

entry.title: Rename telemetry_perf_unittests for android.
entry.content:
An upcoming change will require separate declarations for tests rather

than being able to make them up on the fly in a basic suite. The test

binary will be determined by the declaration of the test and overriding

it won't be allowed. This ensures that for a given test name, the same

binary will be run in all situations.



The only test name that currently violates this constrain is

telemetry_perf_unittests, which runs telemetry_perf_unittests in all

situations except for android where it runs

telemetry_perf_unittests_android_chrome. This changes it so that the

test that runs telemetry_perf_unittests_android_chrome is named

telemetry_perf_unittests_android_chrome to meet that constraint.

entry.title: Generate and store a source value to randomize limited entropy field trials.
entry.content:
During start-up, EntropyState will attempt to load the previously used source value from prefs, and if there is no such value, EntropyState will generate a new value from base::UnguessableToken, and store that to prefs for reuse. Note that this behavior will be true only after callers of these methods are added, which will happen in subsequent CLs.



If the client has been started with –reset-variations-state, during start-up EntropyState will always generate a new source value and store it into prefs, regardless of whether a value is already available there. (As above, the start-up integration itself will be added in subsequent CLs.)



If UMA opt-in status changes, the value from prefs will be cleared. And a new value will only be generated upon restart. This is implemented through EntropyState::ClearPrefs.



There are no changes to the existing low or high entropy sources.



There will be a follow-up CL to sync this source value between Ash and LaCrOS analogous to how the other entropy sources are currently sync'ed.



Bug: b/315349895

entry.title: win: Add support for PWA icons in notifications
entry.content:
This CL makes notifications put up by web apps have the web app's

app user model id (AUMI), which makes them show the web app's name

and icon instead of Chrome's. It does this by passing in

the web app's AUMI to the call to create the IToastNotifier.



It still caches an IToastNotifier, but if Chrome tries to display a

notification with a different AUMI from the one the cached notifier

was created with, it releases the cached notifier and creates a new one.

entry.title: Revert^2 "device selection: Do not special case multi-node changes"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1bdb8d0f4ef1ecb97551055ab72383b388cd9c03.



Reason for revert:

Reland with fix for MemorySanitizer: use-of-uninitialized-value.

DeviceChanges::has_any_change_ must have explicit `= false`.



Original change's description:

> Revert "device selection: Do not special case multi-node changes"

>

> This reverts commit 1ce1705dae28d3d7f56182f66f731aa78292e3d5.

>

> Reason for revert:

> Break tests:

> https://ci.chromium.org/old/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/40053

>

>

> Original change's description:

> > device selection: Do not special case multi-node changes

> >

> > Merge the logic of HandleHotPlugDevice and HandleNonHotplugNodesChange:

> > When multiple audio devices are plugged, treat as if they are plugged

> > one by one. The device selection algorithm is expected to handle

> > scenarios like this well. This would also be more robust on reboots,

> > where it is likely not all audio devices are probed at once and

> > SwitchToPreviousActiveDeviceIfAvailable cannot work reliably.

> >

> > Test fixes:

> > - The new algorithm expects the active device has the highest

> > priority among all connected devices for restoration to work.

> > Update SetupCrasAudioHandlerWithActiveNodeInPref to set the

> > user priority.

> > - Remove uses of kHeadphone. It is special cased to always be

> > selected when plugged.

> > - Explicitly set the active device in

> > ChangeOutputVolumeFromNonChromeSourceNonActiveDevice.

> >

> > Bug: b:304834020

> > Test: autoninja -C out/Default/ chromeos_unittests && out/Default/chromeos_unittests

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Fix timestamp conversion in TimeDeltaToTimeVal()
entry.content:
Said function is used to create the timestamp for the enqueued

OUTPUT queue buffer, timestamp that the driver propagates to the

associated decoded video frame (if any). Current code has a

rounding problem so two timestamps e.g. 1000us and 1001us end

up being the same, making the Renderer client (DecoderStream)

to think that the hardware decoder is broken. This CL fixes

that by implementing the calculations inline.

entry.title: Never put an "outside" list-item marker in an anonymous block.
entry.content:
If a list item has an anonymous block inside (for whatever reason), an

"outside" list item marker is yet to be put on the outside. Normally,

the list item marker is created and attached when the list item is

attached, before any regular children are added, so there'll never be an

anonymous child block. However, if list-style-type is 'none' initially,

there'll be no marker. If list-style-type then is changed later on, we

need to create the marker at that point, and then there may be an

anonymous block to worry about.



BlockLayoutAlgorithm::PositionOrPropagateListMarker() will always add

the marker fragment as a direct child of the list item fragment, and if

this doesn't match the actual layout structure (there's an anonymous

block there), pre-paint will fail when performing a fragment-accompanied

LayoutObject tree walk, which is the case for block fragmentation.

PrePaintTreeWalk::WalkLayoutObjectChildren() won't find the marker,

because it's searching for it inside the anonymous block fragment. But

it's a child of the list item fragment.



Bug: 1510614

Change-Id: I5b63303ce225bc5c89f3ccc52eae41a600a64d8c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5115680

Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1236576}

entry.title: Async clipboard API: improve task source usage.
entry.content:
This effectively gets rid of the "in parallel" part of the

spec algorithms that say "create a promise, then in parallel".

This parallelism isn't necessary and introduces races.

See https://github.com/w3c/clipboard-apis/issues/202



Example of a fixed race: the check that the renderer is focused.

This check could have failed if the site lost focus very shortly

after using the clipboard (albeit not a very catastrophic outcome).

It also has the effect of eliminating an extra copy of clipboard

data, which could save a lot of memory depending on the size of the

payload.



This change also introduces a task source for the clipboard

as mentioned in

https://www.w3.org/TR/clipboard-apis/#clipboard-task-source



This task source is useful for making sure multiple clipboard

operations (reading, writing to the system clipboard) are not

occurring in parallel. Other steps, like when an error condition

causes a promise to be rejected, need not be executed on that same

task source. Note that the spec currently fails to describe many

of the error conditions that Chromium implements. Also note that

Chromium's implementation fails to group steps that should

be part of a single operation into a single task in the queue.

See crbug.com/1510722



Bug: 1510722,1501971

Change-Id: I2eb7e8ca61bd3f7f1830514c8a68b3f1ddec042a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5113849

Reviewed-by: Anupam Snigdha

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Commit-Queue: Evan Stade

entry.title: [webauthn] Let extensions assert RP IDs they have host permissions for
entry.content:
Allow extensions to assert webauthn relying party identifiers of a

web domain they have host permissions for. Extensions were already

allowed to assert their own origin, and this CL does not change that.

Extensions are still not allowed to assert the domains of other

extensions even if they have host permissions, since the API does not

currently allow expressing that in a way that is distinct from web

origins.



Examples for an extension with id `id1`:



Pattern RP ID Allowed?

chrome-extension://id1 Yes

http://localhost localhost Yes

https://*/* com Yes

https://com com Yes

https://*.com example.com Yes

https://example.com example.com Yes

https://*.example.com subdomain.example.com Yes

https://subdomain.example.com example.com Yes

https://*.subdomain.example.com example.com Yes

chrome-extension://id2 No

http://example.com example.com No

https://example.com subdomain.example.com No

https://example.com com No



This change should not fundamentally change the security & privacy

properties of webauthn and extensions, as extensions with host

permissions can script pages running on those hosts and thus assert

the same RP IDs, but it should allow for better UI for legit usecases.



Finally, this CL does not change the origin passed to the

authenticator on the client data json. The origin will match the

extension's.



Fixed: 1504865

Change-Id: I6ff48f8490e1662a9fe275cd504d504ee02bfc47

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5071037

Commit-Queue: Devlin Cronin

Reviewed-by: Devlin Cronin

Auto-Submit: Nina Satragno

entry.title: Reland "[3PCD] Add pixel test for the cookies controls bubble when 3PCD is enabled"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 9efd4d9861d49f5e63c8eaaf50ac941cc6a30f42



Seems like Chrome branded builds do not pick up field trials by default (go/finch-fieldtrial-testing-config#effect-of-field-trial-testing-configs).



The UB icon failed to appear on Chrome branded builds for Mac because of low confidence levels. This was because the `CookiesControlStatus` was set to `kDisabled` (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/content_settings/browser/ui/cookie_controls_controller.cc;l=157-161;drc=3bebb3661e560703cead6b3df137cbdb531a3511), which always results in a `kUninitialized` confidence level (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/content_settings/browser/ui/cookie_controls_controller.cc;l=235-237;drc=3bebb3661e560703cead6b3df137cbdb531a3511), preventing the UB icon from appearing (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/location_bar/cookie_controls/cookie_controls_icon_view.cc;l=298-319;drc=3bebb3661e560703cead6b3df137cbdb531a3511).



This can be resolved by setting either the TrackingProtection feature/pref on or setting the `CookiesControlMode` to block third party cookies (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/content_settings/core/browser/cookie_settings.cc;l=380-405;drc=00378fb2ffec87161bf3f3f6704247397b98ff49).



Original change's description:

> [3PCD] Add pixel test for the cookies controls bubble when 3PCD is enabled

>

> 3PCD status for the cookies controls is updated/set via`OnStatusChange` which will also re-render the bubble.

>

> The existing test has also been adjusted to use `OnStatusChange` to prevent fracturing when compared to the new test.

>

> Bug: b:306151669

> Change-Id: I71b9a6a2335209e962b109b3aef119d621feca8b

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5083718

entry.title: ash: Fixing issues when a display is removed while switching desks
entry.content:
This CL fixes some issues discovered while removing a display during a

desk switch. The RootWindowDeskSwitchAnimator instances will now observe

root window events and DeskAnimationBase will remove any animators that

belong to a root that has gone away.



While debugging this, I noticed that SplitViewMetricsController would

also try to access a root that no longer exists. This controller is

owned by SplitViewController, which is in turn owned by

RootWindowController. With this change, the SplitViewController is

explicitly released during the shutdown of a root window.



BUG=b:297194050



Change-Id: I329eae0a3ee33c95e751da26adf4a18f1496e354

entry.title: Add permission policy verification in PermissionControllerImpl
entry.content:
Currently Permissions Policy are verified in the Renderer process.

//chrome has the Browser process verification in PermissionContextBase.



This CL adds Permission Policy verification to content/. That enables

the Browser process verification for all content/ embedders.



Android WebView is not included as it requires separate treatment.

More details go/webview-permissions-policy



Bug: 1349774
